page.title: 03ENJOYING THE DOWNS
page.content: The South Downs are traversed by several well kept footpaths of great antiquity which are under the control of the East Sussex County Council who have had hunting gates and stiles erected by the Manpower Services Commission. The South Downs Ranger Service helps keep the paths clear on a voluntary unpaid basis at weekends. A blue acorn painted on the gates and stiles indicates it is a long-distance footpath. There are also licensed paths which mean the public has permission to walk on the path but if the landowner finds this privilege is being abused he has the right to close the path by giving three months' notice to the County Council.
